title: FESN - On The Broad
description: "Sequel of "BEHIND THE BROAD", a dvd focusing on a skate shop FAT BROS in Nakano, Tokyo. 38 minutes of aggressive skating with 4 newly sponsored skaters: Yuzo Kudo with good flip tricks and style as seen in "UNDERGROUND BROADCASTING". An old rookie 30 year old Akira fujimoto, originally from Kochi, skating for 20 years and still keeps progressing his bank and tranny skills. Kenji Nakahira, an ollie master originally from Kochi as well, displaying his rare physical talent here in Nakano. Masakazu Aiso, a Numazu, Shizuoka habitat recovering from 2 year blank due to a knee injury, busting his technical tricks. Also includes full length parts by: Takahiro Morita, director of this dvd and still seeking for new tricks and his original skate style and Yoshiharu Yoshida, who puts most importance on street skating. A total skate video format. Jazz sounds produced by Taichi, who made the track for ending section in "43-26" are used for BGM Jazz musicians were gathered specially for this dvd, recording their session watching the footages from the dvd. A raw groove which cannot be seen in former FESN pieces. We present you with 38 minutes of tatally new footages and music."

title: FESN - Subway
description: "Second video for FESN released in February?96. Appearances by many amateur skaters including the ones from regions outside of Tokyo, bringing out the unknowns. In the rookie section, Tokyo Nakano activist Satoru Kuribayashi and from Ikebukuro, big stairs with flip tricks, Munekazu Kitajima were featured. Kyushu tour with Tokyo Z Boys and OWN includes a perfect run at Fukuoka 2 SKATES contest finals taken by Takaoki Hashimoto. For BGM, it starts off with REAL LIVE ?REAL LIVE SHIT?, followed by Jaco Pastorius, Miles Davis, Tom Scott, and so on. Improvised DJ play was put together to the footages in the last video, but this time, footages were put together to the music."

title: FESN - Far East Skate Network
description: "Commemorative debut FESN video released in September,?95. Borderless appearances of pro and am skaters from all over the country who we met through contests and street skating. High-light of the video has to be Keishi Tsuchiya?s part with technique and stylish skating. Also features ?T-19? with Akira Ozawa who entered and won so many contests in the 90s, refined skating by the best skate team of all times ?New Type?, footages of street skaters from Tokyo, Osaka, Kobe, Fukuoka, etc. For music, improvised turntable play by DJ Red, who was the youngest member of a DJ unit ?Kemuri Production? lead by DJ Krush. Improvised turntable play recorded while watching the footages in a studio made the footages more live."

title: FESN - Tozainanboku
description: "Third video for FESN released in March?97. If you saw the first and second video, it?s obvious that this is the video that has lead the direction for FESN by all means. Tracks and mix by DJ BILL DAVIS and DJ RED was used in the first half of the video.(DJ RED was in charge of the turntable play in the debut video[FAR EAST SKATE NETWORK]) In the last half, DJ BILL DAVIS?s solo works were used. Not only both sound of first and last half develops non-stop like the skate footages from all over the country, it was a challenge to attempt a whole new visual expression by using a hiphop form, master mix. All sounds were analog master recorded with 1 inch open reel. Real time linear editing using 2 switchers at the same time, it gave the editing more improvisation. As you can see from the title, the video covers top pros and ams from all over the country, including Kunjiro Eguchi, transplant from New Zealand Simon Locket and Masafumi Kjitani from Osaka who did the first 50-50 on a Shinjyuku handrail. Covering all skaters from regions out ????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????

title: FESN - Behind The Broad
description: "A video focusing on FESN home ground Nakano and an existing local skate shop FAT BROS released in July 5th. A documentary film of THA BLUE HERB, 'THAT'S THE WAY HOPE GOES' was also released simultaneously. This is an exposure of elements of FAT BROS skaters, friends and musicians. A new type art format combining skating, fashion, club music, sense of humor, sampling art and lifestyle. A video that humorously portrays things that can not be seen in a normal skate video with an eye of FESN-behind the skate scene of today which takes skate tricks as first priority. The BEHIND of all things."
